channel.title: Adding tabs to client
channel.description: I'm looking to add a donator tab to my client. It's a basic PI client. I'm looking for someone to point me in the right direction and maybe something might come your way.

item.title: Adding tabs to client
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:3, topic:395588”][quote author=Stupit link=topic=492782.msg3602774#msg3602774 date=1305767711]
I’m looking to add a donator tab to my client. It’s a basic PI client. I’m looking for someone to point me in the right direction and maybe something might come your way.
[/quote]

What exactly do you mean “donator tab”? If you mean like a JTabbedPane, then all you would have to do is switch the Frame or JFrame in Frame_Sub1 to a JPanel, and then whenever you add a new tab, it creates a new instance of the client. However, there would be performance issues, as it would load all the items, objects, npcs, interfaces, animations, etc again each time a new tab is opened. In a case like that, I would suggest you just load all the definitions when the client starts, and then basically just draw the game area in each new tab.

If you mean like a game tab (skills, quests, etc) then you would have to change the gameframe, add some “if mouseX and mouseY are within blah” tweak it as necessary.

I should really get back started on my Interface library =[/quote]
Yes adding a tab in-game. I’m adding a Donator tab with info and other things.
